title: How does it make sense that Champion Mastery has to be partially bought?
body:
It doesn't make sense to me that levels 6 and 7 require blue essence to be "purchased." Shouldn't Champion Mastery be based on a player's mastery with a champion, without incorporating some random currency that doesn't have to do with mastery?

Let's be honest, I think you guys could find a better use for the champion shard and blue essence aspects of Hextech Crafting. Don't tie them in with Champion Mastery for no good reason.

You don't actually _need_ to buy Mastery Ranks 6 and 7. You passively gain key fragments and chests when a player (or yourself) gets an S-grade. Getting both Tokens for 6 (3 for 7) is obviously free, and each of the 3 options available for each after you get the 2 or 3 Tokens can also be gotten for free (although this requires luck or getting rid of Champ shards). It's just much easier to get them by buying chests and keys because of the 3 options for each rank, but it's not an obligation by all means.

I have gotten only one champion shard since Hextech Crafting was released, and I play the game very often.  This is not enough for a single mastery level 6 on any champion, so I essentially can't engage with this release at all.

My only options are as such:

* Wait a month until my key gains reset and hope RNG favors me on the very few chests I get
* Pay for keys/chests and hope RNG favors me

Neither of these options has anything to do with mastering a champion.  They are completely arbitrary restrictions that serve absolutely no purpose whatsoever other than forcing players to either deal with almost nonexistent progression or pay to progress through the system.

Actually, being honest here, you do sort of have to "master" your champion. To get from Rank 5 to 7 on your Champion, you have to perform well enough to get at least 2 S-'s and 3 S's on your grading. While I'm not saying you should be Faker-quality to do that, you do have to be able to do well enough with your Champ so that you know what you're doing and can do it consistently. For example, you have to have a certain K/D ratio as an Bot Carry to achieve S-quality grading; die one-too-many times and you'll end up with an A grade. And you have to do this at least in Normals, so while it's not extremely hard it's definitely more challenging than just challenging Bots.
As for the chest/key probability, this new Mastery Ranking system is meant to be long-term, showing that you are capable of putting enough time and effort into mastering your Champ with more than just play time.

But the blue essence requirement doesn't have anything to do with time or effort spent in mastering your champion. In fact, if you don't want to pay for the chests, it requires you to spend time mastering different champions.

It took me 15 chests to get the 600 blue essence I needed to get one champion up to level 6, meaning that - in order to level one champion up to level 7 - you probably have to open 20-30 chests. With the 4 chests/month limit, you MIGHT be able to get two champions to level 7 each year without buying chests, and you would have to "master" 46 other champions enough to get at least one S rank with them. 

Riot has said that they will add "champion-shard-only" chests that can be bought with IP, which will fix this problem, but it would make more sense if they required a certain number of mastery points in addition to the mastery tokens instead of requiring blue essence. That would actually be an effective indicator of how much time and effort you have spent mastering that specific champion - I have spent time playing it, as you can see by my mastery points, and I have put in effort, as you can see by how many S ranks I have earned.
While your points are true, there's still the matter of getting the Rank 6 and 7 Tokens which has been pretty much my whole point all along.

No one has ever said anything about the Mastery Tokens not representing champion mastery. This entire discussion is about how the blue essence requirement has nothing to do with champion mastery and is _currently_ holding people back from earning mastery levels on champions who they SHOULD  have levels 6 and 7 on because they do have those Tokens. That was the whole point of the original post.
